--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Beachcomber continues on, fascinated by his new companion, but still
> getting lost in the nature of the planet. Finally, after three 
hundred
> years, he has come back to a planet with such organic beauty. He 
makes
> sure to record a birds chirping as he passes by a tree, quite 
pleased in
> its pleasant sound, and resolved to study it later. He heads to the 
top
> of a hill, and stops, transforming. He points downward. "There, 
there's
> Cliffjumper." he says extatically, pointing at a convoy of four 
robots
> at the bottom.


   ::REDHOT::

    The Red Seeker simply gives the Autobot a strange look as he 
absorbs himself in nature. it brings a sly smile to Redhot's face. 
(He's certainly preoccupied) he thinks.
    Redhot snorts when his companion stops and points at the convoy
of 
four robots. He sounds almost exactly like Starscream. He turns to 
Beachcomber, eyes bright with amusement.
    "I suppose we should meet them." he says. "You know them, you 
introduce me. If I approach them first I'll probably spook them and I 
ain't in the mood to be cannon fodder today." The red seeker's
humored 
grin becomes even more so and he looks down the at the convoy. 
Privately he hopes that the reflection from his wings didn't give him 
away.


Northlight
Domnijoe Productions

********************
